title: spack schema version 1.0
description: The spack schema is referenced using ``type: spack`` which is used for generating tests using spack package manager

type.description: Select schema type to use when validating buildspec. This must be set to 'spack'

sbatch.description: This field is used for specifying #SBATCH options in test script.

bsub.description: This field is used for specifying #BSUB options in test script.

cobalt.description: This field is used for specifying #COBALT options in test script.

pbs.description: This field is used for specifying #PBS directives in test script.

compiler_find.description: Run ``spack compiler find`` if set to ``True``. This is run right after sourcing spack startup script.

mirror.description: Add mirror by running ``spack mirror add``

env.description: Manage spack environments via ``spack env`` command

install.description: Install spack packages by running ``spack install``.

verify_spack.description: This boolean will determine if we need to check for file existence where spack is cloned via ``root`` property and file **$SPACK_ROOT/share/spack/setup-env.sh** exists. These checks can be disabled by setting this to ``False`` which can be useful if you dont want buildtest to raise exception during test generation process and test is skipped.

create.description: Create a spack environment via ``spack env create``

remove_environment.description: Remove existing spack environment before creating new environment

manifest.description: Specify path to spack manifest file (spack.yaml or spack.lock) when creating environment

dir.description: Create a spack environment in a specific directory

activate.description: Activate a spack environment via ``spack env activate``

name.description: Name of spack environment to activate.
Remove spack environment by name. This will run ``spack env rm -y <name>``.

mirror.description: Add mirror in spack environment by running ``spack mirror add``

specs.description: Add specs to environment by running ``spack add <specs>``. The ``specs`` is a list of string which expect the argument to be name of spack package.

concretize.description: Concretize spack environment by running ``spack concretize -f``

specs.description: List of specs to install using ``spack install`` command

remove_tests.description: Remove all test suites in spack before running test via ``spack test run``. If set to ``True`` we will run ``spack test remove -y`` which will remove all test suites.

specs.description: List of specs to run tests by running ``spack test run <specs>``.

suite.description: Report results by  suite name by running ``spack test results <suite>``.

specs.description: Report result by spec name by running ``spack test run -- <specs>``.
